body:
Something strange has happened. This change is already on tp34. 

https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/blob/tp34/gremlin-driver/src/main/java/org/apache/tinkerpop/gremlin/driver/Client.java#L346-L347

It's not here though on master for some reason. Where did that commit go and is this the only thing missing? rhetorical question - i'm researching still
oops - my mistake - looking at the wrong method signature. nothing seems missing. i'm surprised that we didn't have this there before though. i wonder how this was missed for all this time.

Thanks for you contribution. A few points:

1. You have targeted the master branch with this change which is 3.5.0 which has no fixed release date at this time. I think you should re-target this PR to tp33 so that it can be applied from 3.3.x forward.
2. Please add a test for this change - perhaps just add a new test here: https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/blob/tp33/gremlin-server/src/test/java/org/apache/tinkerpop/gremlin/server/GremlinDriverIntegrateTest.java
3. Please add a CHANGELOG entry that describes your change (though I don't mind doing that myself on merge).

Thanks @divijvaidya , rebasing onto TP34 introduces a lot of conflicts and I feel it's easier to cherry-pick the change onto TP34 and cut a new PR. Let me do that.

@spmallette Haha, I was also surprised too when I found this today ðŸ˜›

Created a new one: https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/pull/1228
Let's continue the discussion there, closing.
I think you need to rebase this PR or something - please have a look at the commit history. It is dragging in a lot of extra commits.
merged - thanks again @javeme - i look forward to other contributions from you in the future. well done.
Ok, my pleasure to contribute.

> I think you need to rebase this PR or something - please have a look at the commit history. It is dragging in a lot of extra commits.

I have rebase it onto branch tp33 and sort out my commits.
VOTE +1

Other than the wildcard import and a CHANGELOG entry, I think this PR looks good:

VOTE +1

> VOTE +1

I don't know how to add a CHANGE LOG entry, cloud you please doing that on merge(if the pr will being approved)

i can do it on merge but basically you just add a bullet point to this file describing your change:

https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/blob/tp33/CHANGELOG.asciidoc#tinkerpop-3310-release-date-not-officially-released-yet

> i can do it on merge but basically you just add a bullet point to this file describing your change:
> 
> https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/blob/tp33/CHANGELOG.asciidoc#tinkerpop-3310-release-date-not-officially-released-yet

Got it ,and I have update the CHANGELOG.
VOTE +1

@spmallette @divijvaidya Thanks for helping me to move this PR forward !

I restored the squashed imports and added a comment to CHANGELOG.asciidoc.
For some reason my addition to the CHANGELOG is detected as a conflict.

Could you resolve the conflict and merge this if the comment I added looks good ?
Now this branch should be good to merge. Let me know if further tweaks are needed.

I think this approach is fine. Please target the `tp33` branch so that this change goes back to 3.3.x (since this is a security issue). To make this PR complete, please consider a CHANGELOG entry, though I can add that on merge if needed. I think I'd also like to see you change the instantiation of the `XMLInputFactory` as you suggested in your comment.

Assuming all that is done:

VOTE +1
Sorry, rebasing directly on Github UI seems not a good solution to base onto `tp34`... I will make another PR. Thanks.

I just created a new PR: https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/pull/1235
Let's continue the discussion there. Thanks!
VOTE +1
JIRA for this one is closed - reasoning in the comments.
This closed automatically after the renaming of the `tp3*` branches to the `3.x-dev` pattern.
This closed automatically after the renaming of the `tp3*` branches to the `3.x-dev` pattern.

Thank you for submitting this but note that Travis cannot build this PR:

https://travis-ci.org/apache/tinkerpop/jobs/636394809?utm_medium=notification&utm_source=github_status

Also, I'd like to see some examples of what the improvement does - specifically, could you add one or more tests that will trigger this new code and could you please paste a something here in the github comments that shows how the SPARQL compiled to Gremlin before and after this change. I think we will roll your example (and mine) into the upgrade documentation.
Also, I wanted to start a thread on the mailing list to discuss runtime version support policy (for Node.js but could apply to techs), I hope I have time in the next couple of days to do it.
VOTE +1
Once I succesfully compile with mvn clean install, how can I load the sparql-gremlin package into the console? ":install org.apache.tinkerpop sparql-gremlin 3.5.0" doesn't work

well, 3.5.0 isn't published yet but more directly you are targetting the 3.4.x branch which means that `mvn clean install` is publishing "3.4.5-SNAPSHOT" locally:

https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/blob/035d14b7bde1e12ce8892ddab78b12aae202c624/pom.xml#L28

you should use your `:install` command with that version.

@thevalzo i just thought that i'd alert you to the fact that we will be preparing for release of 3.4.5 next week. if you'd like to see this change in that version we would need to sort though this pull request by the end of this week. i'm not trying to pressure you of course...i just wanted to let you know about our release schedule in case this change was important to you and you needed it in the next possible release.

Here we go, thanks @spmallette for your kind support. I haven't added more tests because the FILTER operator is already included in the test cases. In the attached images you can see how the traversal is changed, from a WhereStep clause to a HasStep, which can be optimized for the use of indexes.
![original-sparql-gremlin](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29354446/72809958-fb5c2800-3c5c-11ea-9ec8-1636a2f20f38.JPG)
![modified-sparql-gremlin](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29354446/72809957-fb5c2800-3c5c-11ea-85c8-6df026f55167.JPG)
@spmallette do you have ideas of the reason for which i'm getting a Connection reset error downloading a dependency for a plugin I didn't modify? I did not have this error on my machine.
that could be a travis environmental inconsistency - i restarted the job. let's see if it passes.
VOTE +1
VOTE +1

Thank you for this pull request along with your patience/help in getting it merged. This was a very important fix. Please note that I did refactor the code a bit on merge and did write some upgrade docs as I want to make sure that this improvement gets promoted on release:

https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/commit/7ea3dfadcc48bb2e2c66ca8285995e91cc7287a6

It would be great if you had other ideas for improving sparql-gremlin - I'd be happy to see another pull request in this area.
VOTE +1

I thank you for your precious support too, it has been a pleasure to contribute to this growing project. In the next future I don't think I will have occasion to work again on this, otherwise surely I will do again a pull request. I'll just have you know as you close the Jira ticket that the index optimization isn't complete yet, as other SPARQL operators like UNION, AND, OR remained unoptimized.
i'm sure there are other optimizations that remain to be added. we will simply encourage new tickets to be created for new specific fixes. thanks again

I'm sorry but I've had to revert this PR in preparation for release. I noticed documentation generation failures for sparql-gremlin which pointed to a problem with AND. When you had said that AND wasn't optimized I didn't take that to mean that it wasn't working at all and clearly we didn't have tests in place for that. I've added a test along with the reverting of the change:

https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/commit/d67f7c9c757bfeeaedec4d6650640c1cc4b0aed2

I did try to fix the problem first prior to reverting, but given how close we are to release (Monday) I didn't think I was going to easily solve the problem so it was simply safer to revert. In doing that investigation though I do now better understand what these changes were doing. As I wrote in the commits on the above commit, It made me wonder if we should try to simply optimize `match()` better so that it gives providers a better chance at using an index...in that way we get improvements to `match()` for native usage and to sparql-gremlin and other language compilers. As I mentioned previously, we'll create new JIRA issues as needed for these improvements going forward.
I didn't mean that AND wasn't working at all, but that it wasn't using indexes .. in fact in my tests FILTER { .. AND .. } were working. Which error it gives you?

i get:

```text
gremlin> g.sparql("""SELECT DISTINCT ?name
......1>          WHERE {
......2>            ?person v:label "person" .
......3>            ?person v:age ?age .
......4>            ?person e:created ?project .
......5>            ?project v:name ?name .
......6>            ?project v:lang ?lang .
......7>              FILTER (?age > 30 && ?lang = "java") }""")
The provided match pattern is unsolvable: [[MatchStartStep(person), HasStep([age.gt(30)]), MatchEndStep], [MatchStartStep(project), HasStep([lang.eq(java)]), MatchEndStep]]
Type ':help' or ':h' for help.
Display stack trace? [yN]n
```

Is there anyone else still working/looking at this? We're using @fdominik 's branch -- which is significantly behind version wise?

Browser support would be **amazing** to my team's work

hi @dgyates  -  my [previous comments](https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/pull/1070#issuecomment-468352633) are not yet addressed. If you'd like to pick up from where @fdominik left off and polish this up for a final review by @jorgebay I think we could get this sorted out for next release.

Hi @dgyates I am sorry, I am probably not able to finish it as I don't know how to prepare the travis environment localy and run the failing tests. I am sure that somebody more skilled in JS would be able to resolve such issue in a manner of hous.

Thanks @heljoyLiu for the patch.

Sorry I didn't have time to review it yet, I'll do it this week.

Not sure what's wrong with travis - both are failing due to the docker portion of the build and are related to the python portion of things. The error specifies a missing python module but it builds fine for me locally with a standard maven build as well as a the very docker build being executed in travis. For now let's assume the problem is environmental/travis and not let it get in the way of the review. I'll keep trying to re-run the job periodically and see if i can get it to pass.
any news on this ?

eh - still won't pass on travis. docker works fine for me locally. not going to bother trying anymore. the fix was verified as working on gremlin-users by the person who originally noted the problem so i think we can safely ignore this environmental thing in travis for purpose or review.

Do you have a reference for the iOS platform not being able to handle out parameters? I never heard of this (but I have also never worked on iOS so that doesn't have to say much).
It would be good to know in general whether we need to avoid certain C# features because they aren't supported on some platforms.

I'm using Xamarin Forms platform and they have limitation on iOS documented here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/ios/internals/limitations

But this code is not using any dynamic code so when digging a bit deeper in to the problem it might also be caused of this: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/31075

So issue in dotnet corefx might cause this. I don't know why CreateCustomDelegate method is called when using out IGraphSONSerializer in the code but this might be the source for the exception. But same code without using out parameter works. Could not find any reference that would say this is not allowed in iOS and I'm using out parameters with types like decimal, int, string etc. in iOS without any problems.

OK, thanks for the explanation. It's of course unfortunate that this doesn't work on Xamarin for some reason, but it's only a stylistic change in an internal API, so I'm ok with this.

VOTE +1

@plemanach, have you experienced this timeout?  if so, i have a fix that has been working for a heavily used prod app with no errors for over 6 months.  you can use it while we figure out the best way to handle this.

i have no clue why docker is failing on the gremlin-python portion of the build. works fine for me locally - it's just doing `docker/build.sh` with no flags. not sure if anyone else can get it to fail locally...

As a quick note @heljoyLiu given that we are trying to quickly turn around a 3.4.6 release to fix a bug in 3.4.5:

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7de7d160173d0774720b347122409bb6e46268613205b08edaa687ee%40%3Cdev.tinkerpop.apache.org%3E

it may take some extra time to see this change merged. 

@jorgebay are you ok with this only going to master branch? should it be aimed at a current release branch instead?

As a quick note @justinchuch given that we are trying to quickly turn around a 3.4.6 release to fix a bug in 3.4.5:

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7de7d160173d0774720b347122409bb6e46268613205b08edaa687ee%40%3Cdev.tinkerpop.apache.org%3E

it may take some extra time to see this change reviewed/merged.

> are you ok with this only going to master branch? should it be aimed at a current release branch instead?

Thanks for pointing it out.

Would it be possible to base your PR onto `3.3-dev`, @heljoyLiu ?
Otherwise, I can do it myself after review is finished.
thanks - merged

As a quick note @Haapsaari-Juha given that we are trying to quickly turn around a 3.4.6 release to fix a bug in 3.4.5:

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7de7d160173d0774720b347122409bb6e46268613205b08edaa687ee%40%3Cdev.tinkerpop.apache.org%3E

it may take some extra time to see this change reviewed/merged.

As a quick note @Haapsaari-Juha given that we are trying to quickly turn around a 3.4.6 release to fix a bug in 3.4.5:

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7de7d160173d0774720b347122409bb6e46268613205b08edaa687ee%40%3Cdev.tinkerpop.apache.org%3E

it may take some extra time to see this change reviewed/merged.
@jorgebay  i assume this will wait for merge until after 3.4.6 is released?

yes, there's no rush on releasing it now, the user can always specify the version of the transitive dependencies.
It can wait until after `3.4.6`.

> > are you ok with this only going to master branch? should it be aimed at a current release branch instead?
> 
> Thanks for pointing it out.
> 
> Would it be possible to base your PR onto `3.3-dev`, @heljoyLiu ?
> Otherwise, I can do it myself after review is finished.

ok, Thanks. I will make a new PR with this suggestion on '3.3-dev'

@github5775 When I opened this, it had nothing to do with a timeout, it's just the way Gremlin.NET is handling the data stream (looping rather than event-based) and program flow by exceptions. There is no timeout, certainly not for "lack of activity" as these exceptions happen immediately after opening the connection and retrieving data. My latest test throws 12 internal null reference exceptions with 3 seconds for a single Gremlin query.

Fair enough, but I can live with that.  What I am referring to is when you make a request, that is successful, and then wait an hour, with the code still running, then when you make another request you'll hit a timeout.

What my workaround does is check the connection before submitting the query, and if the connection is not valid, it renews the connection pool, and then submits the query again.
Thanks for your first contribution to TinkerPop, @dzmitry-lahoda, but we already have an open PR for this issue: #1247 which additionally adds another null check for the `receivedMsg` in that method.

Change looks pretty safe. Event check for `null` in message is kind of reasonable, because  could return null https://github.com/JamesNK/Newtonsoft.Json/blob/a31156e90a14038872f54eb60ff0e9676ca4a0d8/Src/Newtonsoft.Json/JsonConvert.cs#L823 . Also at same time not sure if it hides bad JSON setting or other json related behind.  Should we fail totally in this case?
Please merge my absolutely safe PR:) I mean another null check in PR you referenced may be more than really needed and hide errors.

> Also at same time not sure if it hides bad JSON setting or other json related behind. Should we fail totally in this case?

We would still get an error in that case [from here](https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/blob/master/gremlin-dotnet/src/Gremlin.Net/Driver/Connection.cs#L136) where the `receivedMsg` is also accessed without a null check. If `receivedMsg` is `null` then `TryParseResponseMessage` will throw a `NullReferenceException` which will be caught by the try/catch in `Parse` and we notify the response handler about the exception.
I think that we should however ensure that we're not getting an exception in a `catch` clause.

> > are you ok with this only going to master branch? should it be aimed at a current release branch instead?
> 
> Thanks for pointing it out.
> 
> Would it be possible to base your PR onto `3.3-dev`, @heljoyLiu ?
> Otherwise, I can do it myself after review is finished.

I make one new PR on `3.3-dev`,  thanks @jorgebay 

https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/pull/1251

Thanks @heljoyLiu , I'll review it shortly.

Feel free to close this one.

> Will not because message is null. There there is silent error eating.

You're right. I should have looked taken a closer look.

> Could we just check that deserialized object is not null and throw exception.

Yes, I think that might be the best option as we expect the message to never be null. So, if for some reason is actually null, then we can throw an exception which will result in a call to `CloseConnectionBecauseOfFailureAsync` which closes the connection completely and notifies all existing response handlers about the exception.

@Haapsaari-Juha: I don't know if you want to incorporate these changes into your PR as you were the first to contribute a fix for this issue or if @dzmitry-lahoda should update his PR accordingly.

> property based testing for any other array passed

Could you explain a bit further what you mean by this? Do you want to add property based testing for the internal classes of the driver?

Previously if message was null:

1. First line in try fails.
2. Catch fail on first line with null.
3. No handling at all.

Current:
1. First line fails  with reasonable error.

Result:
Exactly same exception handling behavior, but more clean message we can work with.

@FlorianHockmann  I did change in my PR. Please review.

> property based testing

Given we do not have fix which only improves situation (like my PR), we would have to prove.

For this:
0. Check latest Json library and see it returns `object?` - so null is possible. DONE
1. Test with byte array being null, empty. What error we see?
2. Test byte array contains string "null", "", "[]", "{}", not null terminated string, etc.
3. Run generator of byte arrays with https://github.com/haf/expecto#property-based-tests (in C#)

Check that we never ever get null reference in this case. Or in some case we do. Than we should look into Json or into layer creating byte array. And have better semantics for error. 

But this seems no needed for now.

now, syntax is ok, but ThinkerGraph don't support transaction.

how about to skip this session test case ? I check it works in local graph which support transaction

We do test transactions but they only test when Neo4j is present and we only test those with Java test cases. The nature of a session and transactions within a session are already well tested that way. I think that here for a GLV you just want to ensure that the most basic aspect of a session works. The most basic tests to assert that I think would be to create a variable in one request like "x = 1" then in a second request send "x = x + 1" and assert that you get "2" as a result. you may wish to do that in a loop for multiple requests just to demonstrate the ongoing modifications to the session variable "x".

If you rebase, I assume my recent fix for travis will allow the build here to be happy.
